creditline: Gift of Ruth Lathrop Sikes in memory of her brother Bruce Sikes, 1967
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: This series of popular courtesans is a mitate (visual parody) on the classical Chinese set of "Eight Views of the Xiaoxiang Rivers." The courtesan Segawa and her attendant are playing <I>shamisen<I> while returning boats can be seen in the background. Like many of Koryu_sai's prints, it is accompanied by a thirty-one-syllable poem.
title: The Courtesan Segawa of the Matsubaya: Returning Sails
